alert.note: Alert for Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:44PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION COUNTY THROUGH 1115 PM MDT... At 1044 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Des Moines, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Des Moines. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 378 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for northeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass; Union County
